questions.text: You receive an email from 'Netflix Support' (support@netflix-billing.com) stating there's a problem with your payment. It asks you to click a link to update your billing information. The link goes to 'http://netflix.account-update.com'. Is this a phishing attempt?
You get a text message: 'Your package from Amazon has a shipping issue. Please confirm your details here to reschedule delivery: bit.ly/Amz-Track1'. Is this message safe to click?

An email arrives from 'Your Bank' (security@your-bank.com) with the subject 'Security Alert: Unusual Login Attempt'. It states there was a login from a new device and asks you to review the activity by logging in through a provided link. The link is 'https://your-bank.com/login-activity'. The email looks professional. Is it phishing?
A direct message on social media from a friend says, 'OMG! Is this you in this video?' with a link to a site you don't recognize. What should you do?
options: Assume it's phishing and ask your friend about it separately.
Click the link to see if it's really you.
questions.correctAnswer: Assume it's phishing and ask your friend about it separately.

questions.text: You receive an email with a PDF attachment named 'Invoice.pdf' from a company you don't do business with. The email body is empty. Is it safe to open the attachment?

options: A general phishing email sent to a large number of people.
A targeted phishing attack aimed at a specific individual or organization.
A type of fishing that uses a spear gun.
An email that contains a virus.
questions.correctAnswer: A targeted phishing attack aimed at a specific individual or organization.

questions.text: An email appears to come from your CEO asking for an urgent wire transfer to a new vendor. This is an example of what kind of attack?

options: Phishing attacks that use social media.
Phishing attacks conducted via SMS (text messages).
questions.correctAnswer: Phishing attacks conducted via SMS (text messages).
